title: British PM Keir Starmer likely to visit India in October
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Mr. Starmer will hold summit-level talks during the visit, which comes a little more than two months after Mr. Modi visited the U.K. to attend the signing of the U.K.-India free trade agreement.

title: Government announces ₹1,000 crore programme to drive innovation, entrepreneurial growth across Karnataka
content: The Department of Electronics, IT and BT on Monday unveiled a ₹1,000-crore Local Economy Accelerator Programme (LEAP) to drive innovation across the State

title: Canteens operated by Mahalir Thittam SHGs to be opened in Tamil Nadu’s government colleges
content: The institutions have been advised to allocate suitable space on the campuses to set up the canteens and ensure basic facilities such as water, electricity, and waste management support

title: Congress MLA’s call for coalition govt. after 2026 poll sparks divide in Tamil Nadu Congress Committee
content: Among a section of Congress functionaries, there is a feeling that the ruling DMK has kept allies at a distance, hardly consulting them or hearing their grievances

title: Following Allahabad HC’s directives, Uttar Pradesh prohibits caste mention in FIR, political rallies, public signs
content: Ordering a prohibition on caste-based rallies, officiating Chief Secretary (CS) Deepak Kumar said they are organised for political purposes and promote caste conflict in society, which is contrary to “public order” and “national unity.”

title: Plea in Delhi High Court seeks removal of graves of Afzal Guru, Maqbool Bhatt from Tihar jail premises
content: The plea sought directions to authorities to relocate the mortal remains, if necessary, to a secret location to prevent “glorification of terrorism” and misuse of jail premises

title: Assam CM orders autopsy of Garg’s remains after aide is accused of ‘overworking singer’
content: The Chief Minister stated that a post-mortem was ordered in response to public demand. Fans will have the opportunity to pay their last respects to Zubeen

title: Odisha Speaker rejects no-confidence motion moved by Congress
content: The rejection of no-confidence motion notice was deliberate, alleged Congress Legislature Party leader Ramachandra Kadam

title: Doctors’ strike hits healthcare services in Manipur
content: Protesting the assault of a colleague, the State unit of the Indian Medical Association and other medical bodies announced a 24-hour suspension of services at private and government facilities from 6 a.m. on September 23

title: Building collapse in Indore: 11 people rescued, 4 critical
content: Four of the injured are in critical condition, while the condition of seven others is stable, says Arvind Ghanghoria, dean of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Medical College

title: India, Morocco sign defence cooperation MoU to boost strategic partnership
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh also announces opening of a new Defence Wing at the Embassy of India in Rabat, Morocco’s capital; the MoU establishes a robust institutional framework for expanding ties, paving the way for collaboration in defence industry, joint exercises, military training, and capacity building

title: Indian Navy scales up indigenous shipbuilding with 54 vessels under construction
content: 54 vessels are currently under various stages of construction in Indian shipyards; several ships are nearing delivery, with a few to be commissioned this year; India has set a target of expanding naval strength to over 200 warships and submarines by 2035

title: Government specifies tasks of Ministries during calamities
content: The Home Ministry said the Defence Ministry “shall have the responsibility for monitoring, early warning, prevention, mitigation, preparedness and capacity building” with regard to disaster arising from avalanche and oil spills

title: Seat-sharing talks in grand alliance positive, allies to decide CM face: Congress
content: “Sadaqat Ashram (Congress party’s Patna headquarters) happened to be the centre of fight against Britishers and it will again turn into centre of the second war of Independence”, Mr. Allavaru said

title: Social, educational survey hit by technical glitches in Dharwad
content: Mobile application not opening, OTP errors and network issues were the most common problems faced by enumerators at the start of the survey

title: Senior Army officers visit J&K’s Chenab Valley to review operational preparedness
content: The Indian Army is conducting twin anti-militancy operations in the Chenab Valley’s Kishtwar, and Doda-Udhampur belt since Friday evening

title: Number of polluted river sites shows slight reduction: CPCB
content: Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand had the most number of polluted sites; yet, there was a reduction in the number of river locations across India considered ‘most polluted’

title: Madhya Pradesh man lynched in Rajasthan’s Bhilwara on suspicion of cow smuggling
content: The victim, Aasif Babu Multani, and his cousin Mohsin, residents of Mandsaur’s Multanpur, were returning after buying cattle for their agricultural and dairy needs from a cattle mart in Bhilwara’s Lambia Raila, when they were attacked

title: CISF takes over security of upcoming Noida International Airport at Jewar in Uttar Pradesh
content: (photos sent on Delhi netdesk Whatsapp group) The airport, on the outskirts of Delhi, will be the 70th airport in the country to come under CISF cover

title: West Bengal will lose ₹20,000 crore due to GST rate cuts, says Mamata
content: The Union government should not take credit for GST rate revisions as States would have to bear the burden of losses to their exchequer, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said

title: People getting impatient, matters can go out of hand: Ladakh protest leader
content: Cherring Dorjay Lakruk, who along with Sonam Wangchuk is leading the protest for constitutional safeguards for Ladakh, termed the Home Ministry calling a meeting on October 6 for talks a “unilateral” decision that has come late

title: CPI(M) demands public apology from Rajeev Chandrasekar for intimidating journalists over Anil Kumar’s death
content: BJP states that Mr. Chandrasekhar merely exercised his right to reject CPI(M) channel’s politically premeditated attempts to bait him over councillor Anil Kumar’s tragic passing

title: Kerala committed to welfare of expats, says Chief Minister
content: NoRKA Care, a comprehensive health and accident insurance coverage conceived by the government for the Malayali diaspora launched

title: Bihar NDA takes dig at upcoming Congress Working Committee meeting in Patna
content: NDA leaders call it pressure politics to bargain for more seats in alliance; LJP (RV) president Chirag Paswan challenges Congress to contest solo in Bihar, he says that though Congress is the oldest party of the country, it does not dare to contest elections alone

title: VTU takes the first step towards employing AI to set the question papers, evaluate answer sheets for engineering courses
content: V-C said that it is still in experimental stage and will be implemented only when it is 100% foolproof

title: Probhibitory orders imposed in Garag village
content: There is tension following a dispute over constructing a temple on gram panchayat land in the village

title: Jaishankar, Rubio meet as India-U.S. ties hit by tariffs, Russian oil and H-1B visa fees
content: Foreign Ministers met in New York on the sidelines of the UNGA days after Modi-Trump call, avoid press comments

title: CPI(M) seeks police investigation into BJP councillor K. Anil Kumar’s death
content: CPI(M)‘s V. Joy allege that BJP-led cooperative society headed by Anil Kumar incurred massive debt, an estimated ₹6 crore, after borrowers, most of them BJP leaders, dodged loan repayment

title: CEO Rathan Kelkar recommends postponement of Special Intensive Revision in Kerala until after the local body polls
content: Recommendation comes on the heels of political parties, including the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and the Congress, calling for the postponement of the SIR at a meeting of recognised political parties held on Saturday. CEO says catering both to SIR and local body polls will be difficult

title: Girl killed, four injured as wall collapses in heavy rain in Yadrami
content: Residents say that the grievously injured girl died due to lack of medical aid and absence of doctors at the taluk hospital

title: Socio-Educational Survey begins in southern Karnataka
content: The survey is not just a caste census, but an exercise to understand the social, educational, and economic conditions of the people in the State, says Minister for Agriculture N. Cheluvarayaswamy

title: At Sabarimala Samrakshana Sangamam, Annamalai mounts attack on Pinarayi, Stalin
content: Former BJP Tamil Nadu president criticizes Kerala and Tamil Nadu CMs at Sabarimala event, accusing them of opposing Sanatana Dharma.

title: 11 institutions become carbon negative in Kerala
content: Kannur Central Jail is the latest institution to join the list. The listing is based on a carbon emission audit carried out by Haritha Keralam Mission

title: CM praises Kerala Police for leading in law enforcement, social responsibility
content: He says projects such as HOPE and SPC are strong examples of how the police can shape a better society by taking responsibility to uplift lives and instil civic values

title: How Dan Campbell's 'kneecap speech' forever changed the NFL and the Detroit Lions
content: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

title: Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: Sources: Niners' Bosa has torn ACL, done for '25
content: 49ers Pro Bowl defensive end Nick Bosa suffered a torn ACL during Sunday's victory against Arizona and will need season-ending surgery, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: VanVleet has torn ACL, may miss season
content: Rockets star point guard Fred VanVleet has suffered a torn ACL and could potentially miss the entirety of the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Cowboys' Lamb could be out 3-4 weeks
content: Cowboys Pro Bowl wide receiver CeeDee Lamb could miss three to four weeks with a high left ankle sprain suffered in Sunday's loss to the Bears, according to a source.

title: Oklahoma State's Gundy vows he's staying put
content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy, 58, says he intends to keep coaching the Cowboys despite questions about his future following Friday's loss to Tulsa and a 1-2 start to the season.

title: Deion thinks Shedeur will start for Browns in '25
content: Deion Sanders said on the "New Heights" podcast that he believes his son Shedeur Sanders will start for the Browns at some point this season.

title: Tide's Miller, Keenan making '25 debuts vs. UGA
content: Alabama running back Jam Miller and defensive lineman Tim Keenan III will play for the first time this season when the Crimson Tide visit Georgia on Saturday.

title: UCF assistant, ex-App St. coach Clark dies at 50
content: UCF assistant coach Shawn Clark, who was the head coach at Appalachian State for five seasons, died Sunday at 50.

title: 📈 Ranking MLB playoff pitching rotations by tiers
content: Aces matter in the postseason. Here are the contenders who are flush with them -- and which are lacking quality arms.

title: Indiana’s rise, Clemson’s face-plant and more we didn’t see coming
content: Four weeks in, there's no real favorite to win it all or take home the Heisman. Here's what we think we know.

title: Battle for the AL Central: An improbable Guardians comeback and epic Tigers collapse﻿
content: With a week left in the regular season, Detroit and Cleveland are separated by one game atop the division.

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season tips off.

title: Big questions: How concerning is Cowboys' D? Did Chiefs' offense find something?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: The VAR Review: Explaining Bruno Fernandes' 'offside,' Robert Sánchez's red card, Newcastle's penalty claim
content: Looking at Robert Sánchez's red card for Chelsea at Manchester United, a possible offside on Bruno Fernandes' goal and a potential penalty.

title: Dowman? Ngumoha? Yamal? Predicting the 2035 Men's Ballon d'Or
content: What were players doing 10 years before they won soccer's greatest individual prize? Ryan O'Hanlon gets his crystal ball out to see which current rising star will lift the Ballon d'Or in 2035.

title: Ryder Cup 2025: Reliving Team Europe's away wins as Donald aims for fantastic fifth
content: Team Europe, amid all its recent success at home, has managed just four victories overseas against Team USA. Can they make it five at Bethpage?

title: How the Fever stunned the Aces and stole Game 1 in the WNBA semifinals
content: Kelsey Mitchell and Indiana stunned Las Vegas in Game 1. What's next for both teams in the WNBA semifinals?

title: Pete Carroll is accountable for losses, but will he make changes?
content: The promising start of the Carroll era with the Raiders has taken a negative turn. How will Carroll react?

title: Fantasy football pickups: Trey Benson next man up; Raiders offense still has value
content: Highlighting available free agent options after yet another injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 4.

title: Offseason survey: Best and worst moves, LeBron's future and Finals picks
content: League insiders share their picks for the Finals, most head-scratching moves of the summer and LeBron's next decision.

title: Ranking Aces star A'ja Wilson's four WNBA MVP seasons
content: A year ago, A'ja Wilson played arguably the best season in WNBA history. Where does her 2025 MVP season rank?

title: Risers, questions and notes: Could USC have two high-pick receivers?
content: What are scouts saying about Makai Lemon? Is Fernando Mendoza now ready for the QB1 title? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 3.

title: How high can LAFC climb with Son leading a dynamic attack?
content: Pairing Son Heung-min with Denis Bouanga has given LAFC one of the most fearsome attacks in the league, but were they able to break into the top five of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Betting buzz: No. 3 Penn State, No. 5 Georgia favored in marquee matchups
content: No. 3 Penn State is a flight favorite over No. 6 Oregon, as is No. 5 Georgia over No. 17 Alabama in a week with several top-25 matchups.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Marta's Orlando Pride in nine-game rut
content: Orlando have stretched their winless rut to a calamitous nine straight games and are desperately clinching on to a playoff position. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea back in for Maignan to replace Sánchez
content: Chelsea are ready to make a fresh move for AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Harry Styles goes sub-three in Berlin
content: Reportedly racing under the pseudonym "Sted Sarandos," Styles clocked 2:59:13 and took a finish-line photo with Paralympic champion Richard Whitehead.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Four-team mock draft strategy: When to draft Tkachuk, Kucherov and others
content: Four-team leagues are rising in popularity, so our experts mock drafted their teams for a H2H points league.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Show To Return Days After Suspension Over Charlie Kirk Remark
content: Jimmy Kimmel's late night talk show, which was abruptly pulled from the air last week after the US government threatened broadcasters, will be back on Tuesday, Disney announced Monday.

title: Saudi Urges All Countries To Recognise Palestinian State
content: Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan called Monday for all countries to follow a slew of Western countries and recognize a Palestinian state.

title: France Recognises Palestinian State, Macron Says "Time For Peace Has Come"
content: French President Emmanuel Macron vowed Monday in a UN speech recognizing a Palestinian state that he would continue to fight against antisemitism, after criticism from Israel and the United States.

title: All About Trump's H-1B Visa Overhaul That Has Sparked Confusion, Fear
content: The Trump administration's abrupt decision to slap a $100,000 fee on H-1B visas has stunned and confused employers, students and workers from the United States to India and beyond.

title: 15-year-old Girl Raped, Impregnated By Father In UP
content: A 15-year-old girl here has accused her father of repeated rape, resulting in pregnancy, a police officer said on Monday.

title: Another Shooting In Kolkata Ahead Of Durga Puja, 1 Dead
content: A day after a shootout at a gym in Kolkata's Charu Market, another shooting incident was reported from the Garden Reach area on Monday, with one person being found dead, police said.

title: Ex-Banker Duped Of Rs 4 Crore By Nephew Claiming To Be Defence Intelligence Officer
content: A 53-year-old retired bank officer was allegedly defrauded of Rs 4 crore by his nephew who posed as an intelligence officer, the chain of events leaving the victim and his wife homeless, a Pune police official said on Monday.

title: H-1B Visa Could Be Up For Negotiation Once Trade Deal Signed: US Ex-Envoy
content: US President Donald Trump's plan to impose a massive fee on Indians seeking fresh H-1B visas could come back on the negotiating table once the trade deal between the two nations is concluded, former US Ambassador to New Delhi Tim Roemer said.

title: BJP's Annamalai Meets Dhinakaran To Persuade Him To Return To NDA
content: Former Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai called on AMMK general secretary TTV Dhinakaran, who had recently walked out of the NDA, in a bid to persuade him to return to the alliance.

title: Man Shoots Self With Father's Licensed Gun In Greater Noida Park
content: A 22-year-old man allegedly shot himself with his father's licensed gun at a park near his residence in Greater Noida early Monday, police said.

title: UK Charity Cuts Ties With Prince Andrew's Ex-Wife Over Jeffrey Epstein Email
content: A UK children's charity said Monday that it had severed ties with Sarah Ferguson, the ex-wife of disgraced Prince Andrew, after an email emerged between her and convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: 7 Rescued, Several Feared Trapped As Building Collapses In Indore, Rescue Ops On
content: A three-storeyed building collapsed amid rains in Indore in Madhya Pradesh on Monday night, following which seven persons were rescued while a few others are feared trapped under the debris, officials at the site said.

title: 2 Doctors Among 4 Booked For Defrauding Senior Physician Of Rs 70 Lakh
content: Four persons, including two doctors, have been booked for allegedly duping a physician to the tune of Rs 70 lakh by promising his daughter admission in MBBS course at a Mumbai municipal medical college and hospital under the management quota.

title: S Jaishankar Meets Marco Rubio In New York Amid Tariff Row
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met US Secretary of State Marco Rubio here on Monday and discussed a range of bilateral and international issues of "current concern".

title: Mumbai Youth Congress Gets Its First Woman President In Zeenat Shabrin
content: Mumbai Youth Congress member Zeenat Shabrin has been elected the new president of the outfit, becoming the first woman to hold the post after securing the highest 10,076 votes in the recently concluded organisational elections.

title: Dalit Men 'Beaten' Over Temple Entry In Rajasthan's Churu
content: A group of Dalit men was allegedly assaulted for attempting to enter a temple during a religious procession at a village in Rajasthan's Churu district.

title: 'Caste Census' Begins In Karnataka, Technical Glitches Reported In Some Parts
content: The Social and Educational Survey, popularly known as the 'caste census' in Karnataka, commenced on Monday, with enumerators going door-to-door to collect data.

title: Maharashtra Minister Suggests Adding Shrimp Or Fish In Mid-Day Meal In Schools
content: Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane on Monday suggested adding shrimp or fish in mid-day meal for school students, arguing they are a good source of protein and the move will also increase their domestic consumption in the face of high US tariffs.

title: 'Some High Court Judges Unable To Deliver On Their Tasks': Top Court
content: The Supreme Court on Monday lamented some high court judges being unable to "deliver on their tasks" as it called for their "performance evaluation".

title: New GST Rates Highlights: GST 2.0 Takes Effect, Food, Cars, TVs Become Cheaper
content: GST 2.0 Rates Highlights: The new Goods and Services Tax rates have taken effect today, with many items, including daily food and essentials, as well as life and health insurance policies, becoming cheaper.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: US H-1B visa fee: Doctors likely to get exemption from $100,000 charge, says report
content: Following the US President's announcement of a significant H-1B visa fee hike, the White House is considering exemptions for physicians and medical residents. This move comes after a new proclamation imposing a $100,000 fee on H-1B applications, raising concerns about its impact on the tech industry and skilled Indian professionals.

title: Trump's $100,000 H-1B gamble: Why it won’t save US jobs - Winners and losers
content: President Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee has sparked widespread concern across corporate America and immigrant communities. Experts warn this move could stifle innovation, push jobs overseas, and accelerate a talent shift back to India. The policy faces potential legal challenges and could significantly impact tech giants, universities, and startups.

title: 'Only way to beat India...': Imran Khan takes jibe at Pakistan after defeat
content: Imran Khan, the jailed former PM, has taken a dig at PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi following Pakistan's losses to India in the Asia Cup. Khan sarcastically suggested that Pakistan could only win if Gen Asim Munir and Naqvi opened, with other officials as umpires.

title: Afghan teen hides in plane’s landing gear to reach Delhi; deported next day
content: A security incident occurred at Delhi Airport on Sunday when a 13-year-old Afghan boy was found after secretly boarding a Kam Air flight in Kabul by hiding in the landing gear. The boy, from Kunduz, was discovered wandering near the aircraft after it landed. Following questioning and procedures, he was sent back to Kabul on the same day.

title: J&K: Terror suspects seen, search operation launched in Kathua
content: Security forces have launched extensive search operations in the Kathua district following reports of two suspected terrorists. Simultaneously, top military officials are reviewing ongoing anti-terror efforts in the Udhampur, Doda, and Kishtwar regions. These operations intensified after a soldier's death and subsequent gunfights, with aerial surveillance and ground combing underway to locate the militants.

title: H-1B fee hike: Netflix cofounder defends new price, says its ‘great solution’
content: Netflix's Reed Hastings surprisingly backs Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that sharply contrasts with the widespread Silicon Valley opposition. Hastings believes the fee will reserve H-1B visas for high-value jobs, eliminating the need for a lottery. The White House clarified it's a one-time fee for new petitions, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: 'Captain jiska strike rate... ': Shahid Afridi blasts PCB over Salman Agha's appointment
content: Shahid Afridi has strongly criticised Pakistan cricket management's decision to appoint Salman Agha as T20I captain, citing Agha's low strike rate of 79. Afridi questioned how a captain with such a strike rate could inspire faster play.

title: Mahagathbandhan in Bihar: Will seat-sharing arithmetic overshadow vote yatra chemistry?
content: Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav's united show during the "Voter Adhikar Yatra" showcased Mahagathbandhan's unity against the BJP and Election Commission. Despite the apparent bonhomie and mutual endorsements, seat-sharing negotiations reveal underlying tensions. Parties like VIP are demanding significant concessions. RJD and Congress face pressure to accommodate the smaller alliance partners.

title: H-1B visa hike: ‘Do not live in fear,’ says Zoho founder to Indians in US
content: Following a massive H-1B visa fee hike by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu advises Indian tech professionals in America to return to India and rebuild their careers. Drawing parallels with the Partition, he emphasizes India's growing opportunities and the potential for success, suggesting this reverse migration could strengthen India's tech ecosystem.

title: 'Agar main Pakistan ka coach bana': Rohit Sharma's comment goes viral after Ind vs Pak
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive innings propelled India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four stage, marking their second win against their rivals in the tournament. The match was notable for the continued absence of handshakes between the teams, reflecting ongoing political tensions.

title: Jaishankar meets Rubio, marking first meeting since Trump tariffs
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in New York amidst escalating trade tensions. The US has imposed significant tariffs on India, including a 25% charge for Russian oil purchases, and remained silent on the Pakistan-Saudi Arabia defense treaty.

title: Trump’s H-1B move to backfire? Wall Street banks to rely more on Indian GCCs
content: Following the announcement of increased H-1B visa fees, Wall Street banks like Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase may expand their operations in India. Analysts suggest that these restrictions may incentivize banks to strengthen their presence in Indian technology centers, potentially shifting more jobs to India.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Musk recalls his journey, says ‘I’m in America via H-1B’
content: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike in the US, an old post from Elon Musk defending the program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited the H-1B visa for his own success and the growth of companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

title: NFL: Will Jared Goff play tonight? Latest injury update on the Detroit Lions QB
content: In a highly anticipated Monday Night Football clash, Jared Goff is set to lead the Detroit Lions against the Baltimore Ravens. Goff's clean bill of health boosts the Lions' offense as they aim to exploit the Ravens' injury-ridden defense. With key players like Amon-Ra St.

title: Yuvi 2.0! Abhishek Sharma breaks Yuvraj's long-standing Ind vs Pak T20I record
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 off 39 balls propelled India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four clash. Sharma broke Yuvraj Singh's record for the fastest T20I half-century by an Indian against Pakistan, reaching the milestone in just 24 balls.

title: Who is Dominick Reyes’ wife Brenda Lupian? A peek Inside family life
content: Dominick Reyes, the UFC light heavyweight contender, found love and stability with Brenda Lupian, whom he married on January 11, 2025, at the Bella Blanca Event Center. Lupian, with a background in psychology and finance, provides Reyes with crucial support, helping him maintain balance and perspective amidst the highs and lows of his MMA career.

title: Hockey mom Simona speaks on raising NHL brothers Arber & Florian Xhekaj
content: Simona Xhekaj offers a glimpse into the demanding life of a hockey mom, balancing the distinct training regimens of her NHL-bound sons, Arber and Florian. She navigates their differing goals—Arber focusing on shedding fat for speed, while Florian aims to build size—ensuring both stay on track physically and mentally. Her dedication highlights the crucial support system behind elite athletes.

title: Conor McGregor’s one-word reaction to Erika Kirk forgiving suspect
content: Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, stunned mourners by publicly forgiving her husband's suspected killer during a memorial service. Conor McGregor reacted to this profound act with a single, impactful "WOW" on X, which quickly went viral. The internet is now abuzz, debating Erika's message of forgiveness and McGregor's surprising response.

title: US shooting: Teenager critical after being shot in head in Queens
content: A 13-year-old boy is in critical condition after being shot in the head outside a Dunkin' in Cambria Heights, Queens. The incident occurred in the parking lot of a mall on Linden Boulevard and Springfield, prompting a large police response. Residents expressed concerns about safety, especially for students from nearby Andrew Jackson High School who frequent the area.

title: The curious case of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: Why Pakistan bombed its own citizens - what we know
content: Airstrikes in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province resulted in the deaths of at least 23 civilians, including women and children, according to AFP sources. The Pakistani military and government have yet to release an official statement regarding the incident.

title: Trump tariffs: Why India didn't react to 50% duty immediately? Rajnath Singh reveals
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh stated that India didn't immediately retaliate to the US's 50% tariff due to its broad-mindedness. He expressed confidence that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) will eventually become part of India without aggressive action, as its residents are demanding freedom. Singh recalled stating five years ago that PoK would itself want to join India.

title: T-Mobile calls up IIM-grad Srinivas Gopalan as CEO
content: Amidst tightening US immigration policies, T-Mobile has appointed Srinivas Gopalan, an IIM-Ahmedabad alumnus, as its new CEO, effective November 1. Gopalan, previously COO, succeeds Mike Sievert, with expectations high for him to elevate T-Mobile's market position, following in the footsteps of other Indian-origin leaders at major US corporations.

title: Zubeen Garg's second post-mortem tomorrow after public demand: Assam CM
content: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, the state's iconic singer, who passed away in Singapore on September 19. Following public requests, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has ordered a second post-mortem to be conducted at Guwahati Medical College. The funeral will proceed with full state honors on the outskirts of Guwahati.

title: Suryakumar entertains fans with playful remarks after India’s big win over Pak
content: Following India's dominant six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four clash, captain Suryakumar Yadav shared a lighthearted video featuring a dog. India's win, highlighted by Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 and Shubman Gill's 47, marked their second triumph in the tournament against Pakistan. Yadav downplayed the rivalry, stating it's no longer competitive due to India's consistent dominance.

title: Belichick AI video: Jordon Hudson scene stuns; fans call it fake
content: A digitally created video featuring Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson is trending. The video shows them in an intimate moment at a sports game. Many viewers quickly identified it as fake due to visual inconsistencies. Social media users reacted with humor and disbelief. This incident highlights the potential of AI to create convincing yet false content.

title: GST 2.0 kicks in: Firms lower prices, eye bumper sales; consumers set to gain this festive season
content: Indian companies are reducing prices, exceeding GST cuts, to boost consumer demand during the festival season. Businesses across various sectors, from food to footwear, are implementing new price tags and informing distributors. While some sectors express concerns, most anticipate increased sales volumes due to lower prices, with industry bodies ensuring the benefits reach consumers.

title: PM Modi's open letter to citizens: GST 2.0 to accelerate progress of every state
content: Prime Minister Modi announced the 'GST Bachat Utsav,' highlighting the benefits of reduced GST rates for households and businesses. The reforms, effective from September 22nd, feature primarily 5% and 18% tax slabs, lowering taxes on essential goods. These changes, combined with income tax cuts, aim to save citizens approximately Rs 2.

title: Sudha Murthy files FIR: Unknown caller threatens with obscene videos; probe under way
content: Sudha Murty, a Rajya Sabha MP, has reported a cybercrime. She received a threatening call from an unidentified individual. The caller posed as a telecom employee. He claimed her mobile number wasn't linked to Aadhaar. He also mentioned the circulation of obscene videos. The caller threatened to halt her mobile services. Murthy filed a police complaint in New Delhi.

title: Why are Pakistan players avoiding Indian media?
content: Pakistan cricket faces criticism for on-field struggles and media handling, particularly regarding Indian journalists. After losses to India in the Asia Cup, the Pakistan captain avoided press conferences, leading to controversy. When a press conference finally occurred, only Pakistani journalists were allowed to ask questions, highlighting biased media management. The situation raises questions about Pakistan's willingness to face tough questions.

title: Appointed, ignored & unpaid: Meet India's 'invisible' teachers
content: Across India, tens of thousands of teachers work without fair pay, job security, or recognition. Some have waited decades for a salary. Others left the profession broken. A recent Supreme Court verdict granted long-overdue parity to a group of Gujarat teachers — but for thousands more, justice remains out of reach.

title: '5,000 yrs of discrimination': Akhilesh on UP order; flags casteist symbols, mindset
content: Following Allahabad high court's directive to eliminate caste-based discrimination, Uttar Pradesh government ordered removal of caste references from police records and public notices. Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav questioned the Yogi Adityanath government's commitment to eradicating deeply entrenched caste discrimination. He further inquired about measures to address caste-based biases in social interactions and practices, beyond just official documentation.

title: START agreement: Putin says Russia will adhere to nuclear treaty for ‘one more year’
content: President Vladimir Putin announced that Russia will extend its adherence to the New START nuclear warhead agreement with the United States for another year, until February 2026. He emphasized the importance of the treaty for global stability and urged the US to reciprocate by also adhering to its limits.

title: 'Main bhi Bharat hoon': Rajnath Singh says 'PoK will be ours on its own'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed the Indian community in Morocco. He stated that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir will be a part of India without any aggressive actions. He mentioned that the people of PoK are unhappy and want freedom. He also addressed the US tariff issue, stating that India does not react immediately. He said broad-minded people do not react immediately.

title: Brain health boost: 3 simple exercises to rewire your mind; improve focus
content: Research indicates that activities like dance, martial arts, and team sports significantly enhance cognitive function beyond traditional workouts. These complex movements stimulate the brain, improving memory, attention, and decision-making skills. Studies reveal measurable brain changes, including increased gray matter and improved executive functions, highlighting the potential for lifelong brain development through enriched physical activity.

title: Sophie Cunningham emotional: Fever beat Aces; 'that’s big time'
content: Despite her MCL injury, Sophie Cunningham passionately supported the Indiana Fever's playoff victory over the Las Vegas Aces. She expressed her excitement from the stands and in social media posts. Cunningham also discussed the crucial matchup between Aliyah Boston and A'ja Wilson, highlighting its importance for the Fever's success, emphasizing the team's underdog mentality against the Aces.

title: Asia Cup: Abhishek Sharma's 'L' celebration against Pak: Who was it aimed at?
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 off 39 balls against Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four propelled India to a dominant six-wicket victory. His blistering innings, featuring the fastest half-century by an Indian against Pakistan, set the stage for an easy chase of 172. India now lead the table in the Super Fours stage.

title: Honda Cars get GST price cuts- Here are model-wise details
content: Honda Cars India has announced revised prices across its lineup following the implementation of GST Reforms 2025. Effective from September 22, 2025, the new pricing structure brings down the cost of popular models like the Amaze, City, and Elevate.

title: Ba***ds of Bollywood: NHRC seeks action over Ranbir Kapoor e-cigarette scene
content: Aryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' faces legal trouble as the NHRC seeks an Action Taken Report from the I&B Ministry and Mumbai Police. A complaint alleges Ranbir Kapoor's cameo features him using a banned e-cigarette without warnings, potentially influencing young viewers negatively. The complainant, Vinay Joshi, argues the scene promotes illegal activities and disrespects the law.

title: 'Maarna vs ragad ragad ke dhona': Ex-cricketer's fiery reaction after Ind thrash Pak
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 propelled India to a dominant six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four clash. Chasing 172, India's openers, Abhishek and Shubman Gill (47), forged a blistering 105-run partnership, dismantling Pakistan's bowling attack.

title: 'GST Bachat Utsav': PM Modi interacts with traders and entrepreneurs in Tripura
content: Prime Minister Modi engaged with local artisans and entrepreneurs in Tripura and Itanagar, highlighting the benefits of new GST reforms and the 'GST Bachat Utsav' for key sectors. He laid the foundation for development projects in Arunachal Pradesh and inaugurated the redeveloped Tripureswari Temple in Tripura, emphasizing the importance of 'Made in India' products and Northeast development.

title: ‘Will you give up the foreign jet you roam around in?’ Kejriwal on PM’s 'swadeshi' push
content: Arvind Kejriwal criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call for Swadeshi, questioning Modi's own use of foreign goods, including his airplane. AAP MP Sanjay Singh accused Modi of hypocrisy, citing his reliance on international brands while advocating for indigenous products. These remarks followed Modi's address urging citizens to prioritize Made in India products and promote Swadeshi in every home and shop.

title: Elon Musk on H-1B visas: Former holder, system critic; balancing reform and talent
content: Elon Musk, once an H-1B visa holder himself, champions the program for enabling his success with Tesla and SpaceX by attracting global talent. While acknowledging its crucial role in filling skill gaps, Musk criticizes the H-1B system as "broken," advocating for reforms like higher salary thresholds to prevent misuse and protect domestic workers.

title: Latest projections for all 46 postseason CFB games
content: the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 . this season's national championship game will be played in the new year's six bowls .

title: Baku has Verstappen smelling blood in the water, McLaren hearing 'Jaws' theme
content: Max Verstappen wins the Azerbaijan Grand Prix . the Dutchman finishes ahead of George Russel in second and Carlos Sainz in third . f1's 2025 title fight is a sloppy weekend for the team .

title: Wrestlepalooza grades: Did Rhodes-McIntyre, Cena-Lesnar get above-average marks?

title: Yogi Berra, the Yankees and the biggest game of catch ever
